verses.text_plain: And Joseph fell upon his father’s face, and wept upon him, and kissed him.
verses.verse_html: 1And Joseph fell upon his father’s face, and wept upon him, and kissed him.

verses.text_plain: And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father: and the physicians embalmed Israel.
verses.verse_html: 2And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father: and the physicians embalmed Israel.

verses.text_plain: And forty days were fulfilled for him; for so are fulfilled the days of those which are embalmed: and the Egyptians mourned for him threescore and ten days.
verses.verse_html:
3And forty days were fulfilled for him; for so are fulfilled the days of those which are embalmed: and the Egyptians mourned for him threescore and ten days. ▼
▼ mourned: Heb. wept

tokens.text: for him; for so are fulfilled

verses.text_plain: And when the days of his mourning were past, Joseph spake unto the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found grace in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,
verses.verse_html: 4And when the days of his mourning were past, Joseph spake unto the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found grace in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,

tokens.text: I pray you, in the ears

verses.text_plain: My father made me swear, saying, Lo, I die: in my grave which I have digged for me in the land of Canaan, there shalt thou bury me. Now therefore let me go up, I pray thee, and bury my father, and I will come again.
verses.verse_html: 5My father made me swear, saying, Lo, I die: in my grave which I have digged for me in the land of Canaan, there shalt thou bury me. Now therefore let me go up, I pray thee, and bury my father, and I will come again.

tokens.text: Now therefore let me go up

verses.text_plain: And Pharaoh said, Go up, and bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.
verses.verse_html: 6And Pharaoh said, Go up, and bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.

tokens.text: according as he made thee swear

verses.text_plain: And Joseph went up to bury his father: and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt,
verses.verse_html: 7And Joseph went up to bury his father: and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt,

verses.text_plain: And all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father’s house: only their little ones, and their flocks, and their herds, they left in the land of Goshen.
verses.verse_html: 8And all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father’s house: only their little ones, and their flocks, and their herds, they left in the land of Goshen.

verses.text_plain: And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen: and it was a very great company.
verses.verse_html: 9And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen: and it was a very great company.

verses.text_plain: And they came to the threshingfloor of Atad, which is beyond Jordan, and there they mourned with a great and very sore lamentation: and he made a mourning for his father seven days.
verses.verse_html: 10And they came to the threshingfloor of Atad, which is beyond Jordan, and there they mourned with a great and very sore lamentation: and he made a mourning for his father seven days.

verses.text_plain: And when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said, This is a grievous mourning to the Egyptians: wherefore the name of it was called Abel–mizraim, which is beyond Jordan.
verses.verse_html:
11And when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said, This is a grievous mourning to the Egyptians: wherefore the name of it was called Abel–mizraim, which is beyond Jordan. ▼
▼ Abel–mizraim: that is, The mourning of the Egyptians

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Abel–mizraim: that is, The mourning of the Egyptians
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Abel–mizraim: that is, The mourning of the Egyptians

verses.text_plain: And his sons did unto him according as he commanded them:
verses.verse_html: 12And his sons did unto him according as he commanded them:

tokens.text: unto him according as he commanded

verses.text_plain: For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham bought with the field for a possession of a buryingplace of Ephron the Hittite, before Mamre.
verses.verse_html: 13For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham bought with the field for a possession of a buryingplace of Ephron the Hittite, before Mamre.

verses.text_plain: And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.
verses.verse_html: 14And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.

verses.text_plain: And when Joseph’s brethren saw that their father was dead, they said, Joseph will peradventure hate us, and will certainly requite us all the evil which we did unto him.
verses.verse_html: 15And when Joseph’s brethren saw that their father was dead, they said, Joseph will peradventure hate us, and will certainly requite us all the evil which we did unto him.

verses.text_plain: And they sent a messenger unto Joseph, saying, Thy father did command before he died, saying,
verses.verse_html:
16And they sent a messenger unto Joseph, saying, Thy father did command before he died, saying, ▼
▼ sent: Heb. charged

verses.text_plain: So shall ye say unto Joseph, Forgive, I pray thee now, the trespass of thy brethren, and their sin; for they did unto thee evil: and now, we pray thee, forgive the trespass of the servants of the God of thy father. And Joseph wept when they spake unto him.
verses.verse_html: 17So shall ye say unto Joseph, Forgive, I pray thee now, the trespass of thy brethren, and their sin; for they did unto thee evil: and now, we pray thee, forgive the trespass of the servants of the God of thy father. And Joseph wept when they spake unto him.

tokens.text: and now, we pray thee, forgive

verses.text_plain: And his brethren also went and fell down before his face; and they said, Behold, we be thy servants.
verses.verse_html: 18And his brethren also went and fell down before his face; and they said, Behold, we be thy servants.

verses.text_plain: And Joseph said unto them, Fear not: for am I in the place of God?
verses.verse_html: 19And Joseph said unto them, Fear not: for am I in the place of God?

tokens.text: I in the place of God

verses.text_plain: But as for you, ye thought evil against me; but God meant it unto good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save much people alive.
verses.verse_html: 20But as for you, ye thought evil against me; but God meant it unto good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save much people alive.

tokens.text: But as for you, ye thought

verses.text_plain: Now therefore fear ye not: I will nourish you, and your little ones. And he comforted them, and spake kindly unto them.
verses.verse_html:
21Now therefore fear ye not: I will nourish you, and your little ones. And he comforted them, and spake kindly unto them. ▼
▼ kindly…: Heb. to their hearts

footnotes.body_html: ▼ kindly…: Heb. to their hearts

verses.text_plain: And Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his father’s house: and Joseph lived an hundred and ten years.
verses.verse_html: 22And Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his father’s house: and Joseph lived an hundred and ten years.

verses.text_plain: And Joseph saw Ephraim’s children of the third generation: the children also of Machir the son of Manasseh were brought up upon Joseph’s knees.
verses.verse_html:
23And Joseph saw Ephraim’s children of the third generation: the children also of Machir the son of Manasseh were brought up upon Joseph’s knees. ▼
▼ brought…: Heb. born

verses.text_plain: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I die: and God will surely visit you, and bring you out of this land unto the land which he sware to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.verse_html: 24And Joseph said unto his brethren, I die: and God will surely visit you, and bring you out of this land unto the land which he sware to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.

verses.text_plain: And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you, and ye shall carry up my bones from hence.
verses.verse_html: 25And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you, and ye shall carry up my bones from hence.

tokens.text: you, and ye shall carry up

verses.text_plain: So Joseph died, being an hundred and ten years old: and they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in Egypt.
verses.verse_html: 26So Joseph died, being an hundred and ten years old: and they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in Egypt.
